body: CHERRYL MITCHELL is a native New Yorker, born and raised in Brooklyn. But she's quick to tell you she doesn't think much of life in the city, or the ''concrete forest,'' as she calls it. ''I left and I've never missed it or looked back,'' she said. ''Now I hear birds and see real trees when I wake up.'' While there are trees in Brooklyn, and birds,
title: Life on the Edge; How High a Fence Is the City Line?

body: NASSAU COUNTY turned 100 years old on Jan. 1, and to give the centennial mark its due, Hofstra University is gathering experts on the county's rich history to tell one tale after another of how the area got to where it is today. One of those people will be George F. Maher. The job of Mr. Maher, a retired Nassau County police officer, is to present
title: The History of Nassau, 100 Years in the Making
